metadata.Title: CVE-2019-9797 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.Description:
Cross-origin images can be read in violation of the same-origin policy byexporting an image after using createImageBitmap to read the image and thenrendering the resulting bitmap image within a canvas element. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 66.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9797` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 66.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '66.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3').
